snippet: General Motors and France’s PSA Peugeot Citroën, both struggling in Europe, said they were forming an alliance to share car platforms and purchasing power.
abstract: General Motors agrees to form an alliance with French automaker PSA Peugeot Citroen to share car platforms and purchasing power; it will purchase a 7 percent share in the company.
lead_paragraph: General Motors and France’s PSA Peugeot Citroën, both struggling in Europe, said they were forming an alliance to share car platforms and purchasing power.

headline.seo: G.M. to Take 7 Percent Stake in Peugeot
headline.main: Through Alliance, G.M. to Take a Stake in Peugeot
headline.print_headline: Through Alliance, G.M. to Take a Stake in Peugeot
